actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to exempt individuals over age seventy from Federal income tax.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to exempt individuals over the age of 70 from the Federal income tax. Provides that, in the case of married individuals filing joint returns, if one spouse meets the age requirement, both spouses shall be treated as meeting such requirement. Excludes nonresident aliens from the provisions of this Act.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to exempt individuals over age seventy from Federal income tax.
